intro: Draba terekemensis, commonly known as the Terekemene whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rosette structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
